FaqData.title: What is WieFührerschein?
FaqData.content: WieFührerschein is a service that connects driving students and driving schools on a central platform. Students can track their learning progress, book appointments, and communicate with their driving school. Driving schools use our platform to manage their students, coordinate appointments, and optimize their communication.

FaqData.title: What do I need to apply for a driver's license?
FaqData.content:
To apply for a driver's license, you will generally need the following documents:
• Identity card or passport
• Biometric passport photo
• Eye test certificate (not older than two years)
• Proof of participation in a first aid course
• If applicable, registration confirmation from your driving school

FaqData.title: Where do I have to go to apply for my driving license?
FaqData.content: You submit the application to the driver's license authority responsible for your place of residence. When you enter your place of residence, we will show you which authority is responsible for you. Your driving school can often also assist you with this step.

FaqData.title: What driving license classes are there?
FaqData.content:
There are six driving license classes: A, B, C, D, L, and T. The most common car licenses are classes B and BF17.
• Class B: Allows you to drive motor vehicles up to 3.5 tons total weight. The minimum age is 18 years.
• Class BF17: This is 'accompanied driving from the age of 17'. The same conditions as class B apply, but you may only drive when accompanied by a registered person.
On our website, under the Driving License Classes section, you can see all classes and their differences.

FaqData.title: How many theory lessons do you have to take?
FaqData.content: The number of theory lessons depends on the driver's license class. For classes A and B, 12 double lessons of basic theory and two double lessons of class-specific instruction are required. If you extend your license (e.g., if you already have a driver's license), the total number of lessons is reduced to 8. The total number of lessons for class C is 18, and for class D, 20.

FaqData.title: How many driving lessons do you have to take?
FaqData.content:
There is no minimum number of regular practice lessons – it depends on your learning progress, and your instructor decides when you are ready for the test. In addition, the following special driving lessons are legally required:
• Class A: 12 special driving lessons
• Class B: 12 special driving lessons
• Class C: 10 special driving lessons
• Class D: 10 special driving lessons

FaqData.title: How do I get my driver's license after the test?
FaqData.content: After passing the practical test, you will either receive your license directly from the examiner or a few days later by mail or collection at the driving license authority – depending on the region.

FaqData.title: When does my driver's license need to be exchanged?
FaqData.content: All driving licenses issued before January 19, 2013, must be gradually exchanged for the new EU card-based driving license. The deadlines are staggered according to your year of birth or the date the driving license was issued. As a general rule, the new driving license must be renewed every 15 years, although the driving license itself remains valid for an unlimited period.

FaqData.title: How do you convert a driver's license?
FaqData.content: A foreign driver's license is only valid in Germany for a limited time (usually 6 months after taking up residence). Depending on the country where your license was issued, a theoretical and/or practical test may be required. There are exceptions if there is an agreement on mutual recognition between Germany and the issuing country. To convert your license, you must apply for conversion at the responsible driver's license authority in your place of residence. We will guide you step by step through this process when you register on our website.

LicenseSteps.title: Steps For All Driving License Classes
LicenseSteps.dataA: Motorcycles in four categories, from light mopeds to larger motorcycles.
LicenseSteps.dataB: Passenger cars and light commercial vehicles, excluding motorcycles.
LicenseSteps.dataC: Trucks and motor vehicles with a maximum permissible mass of more than 3,500 kg.
LicenseSteps.dataD: Buses and motor vehicles used to transport more than 8 people.
LicenseSteps.dataL: L stands for agricultural and T for tractor. These classes apply to tractors.
LicenseSteps.dataRewrite: Anyone who moves permanently to Germany from third countries must have their foreign driving license converted.
